Package gobblin.runtime.api

The Gobblin Execution Model.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Configurable
    A generic interface for any class that can be configured using a Config.
    EventMetadataGenerator
    For generating additional event metadata to associate with an event.
    GobblinInstanceDriver
    An interface that defines a Gobblin Instance driver which knows how to monitor for Gobblin JobSpecs and run them.
    GobblinInstanceEnvironment
    Defines Gobblin a set of standard configuration features for a gobblin instance.
    GobblinInstanceLauncher
    Main class instantiated by the JVM or running framework.
    GobblinInstancePlugin
    The interfaces for Gobblin instance plugins.
    GobblinInstancePluginFactory
    Creates a GobblinInstancePlugin for a specific GobblinInstanceDriver .
    JobCatalog
    A catalog of all the JobSpecs a Gobblin instance is currently aware of.
    JobCatalogListener
    A listener for changes to the JobSpecs of a JobCatalog.
    JobCatalogListenersContainer
    Manages a collection of JobCatalogListeners .
    JobCatalogWithTemplates
    A JobTemplate that supports loading JobTemplates.
    JobExecution
    Identifies a specific execution of a JobSpec
    JobExecutionDriver
    Defines an implementation which knows how to run a GobblinJob and keep track of the progress.
    JobExecutionLauncher
    A factory for JobExecutionDrivers.
    JobExecutionStateListener
    Notification for changes in the execution state
    JobExecutionStateListenerContainer
    Defines an interface for managing a collection of s
    JobExecutionStatus  
    JobLifecycleListener
    A listener that can track the full lifecycle of a job: from the registering of the jobspec to completion of any of the job executions.
    JobLifecycleListenersContainer
    An interface for managing instances of JobLifecycleListener.
    JobSpecMonitor
    Discovers jobs to execute and generates JobSpecs for each one.
    JobSpecMonitorFactory
    A fact
    JobSpecSchedule
    The schedule for a job
    JobSpecScheduler
    Early alpha of the scheduler interface which is responsible of deciding when to run next the GobblinJob identified by a JobSpec.
    JobSpecSchedulerListener
    JobSpecScheduler callbacks.
    JobSpecSchedulerListenersContainer
    Implemented by classes that can manage a collection of JobSpecSchedulerListener instances.
    JobTemplate
    An interface for claiming methods used for retrieving template configs and properties that are required by user to fit in.
    MutableJobCatalog
    A JobCatalog that can have its Collection of JobSpecs modified programmatically.
    MutableSpecCatalog
    A SpecCatalog that can have its Collection of Specs modified programmatically.

    SpecCatalogListenersContainer  
    SpecCompiler
    Take in a logical Spec and compile corresponding materialized Specs and the mapping to SpecExecutorInstance that they can be run on.
    SpecSerDe
    A Serializer / Deserializer for Spec.
    SpecStore

Package gobblin.runtime.api Description

The Gobblin Execution Model.

The Gobblin launcher components:

Gobblin instance
A self-contained context for running alike Gobblin jobs. These jobs share location where they are stored and managed, how they are scheduled, and how they are run.
Gobblin instance driver (GobblinInstanceDriver)
Starts all global Gobblin services, instantiates Job Catalog, Job Launcher, and scheduler. Interprets job specs to schedule via the executor or run immediately. (Similar to original JobScheduler class).
Gobblin instance launcher (GobblinInstanceLauncher)
Main class instantiated by the JVM or running framework. Reads application level configurations, instantiates and runs the Gobblin instance driver. Examples: JavaMainAppLauncher (original SchedulerDaemon), AzkabanAppLauncher (original AzkabanJobLauncher).
Gobblin job
An execution unit that can ingest and process data from a single source.
JobSpec
The static part of a job, describes the job name, group, and associated configuration.
JobExecution
A specific execution of the job.
JobExecution Driver
Executes the job and its tasks. This can be done locally in a thread-pool, or as a M/R job, as a Yarn job using the Helix task execution framework, etc. This concept replaces the previous JobLauncher.
JobExecution Launcher (JobExecutionLauncher)
Instantiates the JobExecution Driver. The driver may be instantiated locally, or it can be launched in a remote container (similarly to Oozie). JobExecutionLauncher should not be confused with the legacy JobLauncher. Essentially, we decided to roughly split the JobLauncher into JobExecutionLauncher and a JobExecutionDriver. This allows us to abstract the aspect of instantiating and running the JobExecutionDriver. Thus, we have the option of running the driver locally or remotely.
Job catalog (JobCatalog)
Maintains the collection of JobSpecs known to a specific Gobblin instance.
JobSpec Monitor (JobSpecMonitorFactory)
Discovers jobs to execute and generates job specs for each one.
Job Scheduler (JobSpecScheduler)
A pluggable scheduler implementation that triggers job executions on a schedule. Examples: Quartz, pass-through.

Overall, in the current design, Gobblin defines an execution hierarchy: a Gobblin Instance runs zero, one or more Gobblin Jobs which consist of zero, one or more tasks. For each of the levels in the hierarchy, there is a Driver which is responsible of running the children components and a Launcher which is responsible for instantiating and invoking the Driver.
